techmeme.title: Meituan, Alibaba, and JD.com vow to curb "disorderly competition" and limit their price wars in China's food delivery space after warning from Chinese regulator (Bloomberg)
Nintendo reports Q1 revenue up 132% YoY to ~$3.8B, operating profit up 4.4% to ~$378M, and 5.82M Switch 2 sales, more than double of Switch 1 in its first month (Ryan Browne/CNBC)
Games industry trade organizations and gamers are speaking out against censorship campaigns that have forced Steam and Itch.io to mass deindex NSFW content (Megan Farokhmanesh/Wired)
Neuralink plans a UK clinical trial to test how its chips let patients with severe paralysis control devices with thoughts, marking its entry into the country (Christy Santhosh/Reuters)
Prophet Security, which develops fully autonomous AI agents for cybersecurity defense, raised a $30M Series A led by Accel (Michael Nuñez/VentureBeat)
